result.execSummary:
The defendant Blaine J. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Follow assessment recommendations.
Follow rules and pay fees of supervision.  
Submit DNA sample.
No contact with any Fleet Farms.
Sentenced pursuant to 973.015.  May petition for expungement upon successful completion of probation on form CR-266.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by CALLING the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, to set up an appointment during the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00. p.m. Monday through Friday, at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blaine J. Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Blaine J. Brown in court with attorney Amanda Belville.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court grants defendant motions to have the Criminal Complaint redacted.

Defendant Blaine J. Brown in court with attorney Kristina M. Sanders-Brown.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
REPORT TO WINNEBAGO COUNTY JAIL FOR FINGERPRINTING AND PHOTO PURSUANT TO WIS STATS 970.02(7).  NO CONTACT WITH FLEET FARM.

Defendant Blaine J. Brown in court with attorney Amanda Belville.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
